name: Whose Mic Is It Anyway - Mixed Open Mic Event
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

name: Dialogues with Books: A Mystery Awaits
description: Dialogues with Books Monthly Meetup: A Mystery AwaitsThis month, DWB is diving into the shadows for a genre-specific gathering that’s all about Mystery!Whether you're into classic whodunits, psychological thrillers, cozy mysteries, or gritty noir, we’re shining the spotlight on all things enigmatic. From iconic authors like Conan Doyle, Agatha Christie and Raymond Chandler to modern masters like Tana French, Jane Harper and Gillian Flynn- this meetup is for the curious, the clue-hunters, and the plot-twist lovers.Bring your favourite mystery book, a recommendation, or just your sleuthing spirit. Let’s crack open some secrets together. 🔎What is Dialogues with Books: DWB is one of Bangalore's much loved book communities. With a thriving online community and engaging monthly meetups/events, we have over the years carefully created a close knit group of bibliophiles and enthusiastic readers.We meet up regularly on the third Sunday of every month.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

name: Full Moon Rituals - Sound Healing & Journalling
description: The full moon is a sacred moment to pause, slow down, and look within. It’s a time to reflect, let go of what no longer serves you, and notice what has come to light. By letting go, you make space for new energy, new intentions, and new possibilities. A time for release, gratitude, and gentle closure.In this gently guided session, we’ll move through:✨ Breathwork – To ground yourself and create space within.📝 Reflection & Journaling – To process your thoughts and emotions with clarity.🌕 Letting Go Ritual – To lovingly release what’s holding you back and make space for new possibilities.🎶 Sound Healing – To soothe the nervous system and release stagnant energy.Together, we’ll create a space for deep connection with yourself, your intentions, and the energy of new beginnings. Come as you are, and allow yourself to soften into this moment of self-care and renewal.About the FacilitatorSneha a sound healer, mindfulness guide, and someone who’s walked the path from burnout to inner clarity. After years in the corporate world as a CA, I made an intentional shift, from spreadsheets to sound bowls, from deadlines to deep presence. Life gave me the courage to tune into my inner wisdom, and that led me here- to the path of healing, mindfulness, and holding space for othersToday, I blend sound healing, mindfulness and psychology to help people feel more grounded, present, and connected to themselves. My work is heart-led, real, and rooted in everything I have experienced & learnt along the way.

name: Blueprint of Burden: Screening An Engineered Dream
description: A screening of "An Engineered Dream"Followed by a Q&A with director Hemant GabaStep into the high-pressure world of Kota, where over a hundred thousand students arrive each year chasing dreams not always their own. An Engineered Dream is a powerful documentary exploring how societal and parental expectations shape — and sometimes shatter — the futures of India's youth.This eye-opening film examines the intense culture of coaching institutes and the emotional toll it takes, set against the backdrop of their lives and dreams.🗣️ Stay after the screening for a live conversation with director Hemant Gaba, followed by an audience Q&A.

name: Wine Tasting: A Night in Red with Penfolds
description: Bangalore wine lovers — ready for a legendary Friday night?Join us for A Night in Red with Penfolds: an epic wine tasting evening that brings together five premium wines, bold flavours, and unbeatable vibes at the stunning Muro, Bangalore. Hosted by two fun wine geeks, Sommelier Devati Mallick (Founder, Drink With D Wine Experiences) and Penfolds Brand Ambassador Joshua Lim, expect an exciting deep dive into the world of Penfolds, Australia’s most legendary winery!We’re tasting 5 iconic wines from the Penfolds portfolio, including a tasting of the famed Bin Series:– Koonunga Hill Chardonnay– Koonunga Hill 76 Shiraz Cabernet– Bin 2 Shiraz Mataro– Bin 28 Shiraz– Bin 389 Cabernet Shiraz (The famous Baby Grange)This and 5 specially curated Muro small plates that are as bold and flavour-packed as the wines. Expect an evening of stories, sips, elevated pairings, and great conversations — all in an intimate, luxurious, and fun vibe with our cool wine community in the city!Dress code: Red, or any shade of red. Bring in the RED energy!If you’re a red wine lover, a Penfolds fan, or just here for an unforgettable wine experience, this one’s for you. Come, swirl, sip, and experience an EPIC Friday night with us.20 seats only!

name: Anime Pop-Up @ Bento Bento
description: Bento Bento Presents: An Anime-Inspired Culinary Experience14th & 15th June | 12:30–3:00 PM, 7:00–10:00 PMBento Bento is back with a new celebration of food and fandom — this time diving into the vibrant and flavourful world of anime.Inspired by iconic scenes and comfort meals from some of Japan’s most beloved anime series, this curated pop-up brings to life dishes that fans have seen on screen and long wondered about. With past tributes to Studio Ghibli and Midnight Diner, Bento Bento now takes a fresh turn towards the fast-paced, heartfelt, and imaginative food culture of anime.Chef Anumitra, whose culinary roots are shaped in part by her time in Japan, brings a deep respect for authenticity while channeling the visual flair and nostalgia that these shows evoke. Whether you’re a long-time anime fan or a curious food lover, Bento Bento invites you to taste the flavours of your favourite shows.Come hungry. Leave nostalgic. THE MENUSweets & SnacksDorayaki – Doraemon Soft, fluffy pancakes filled with sweet red bean paste. This is Doraemon’s favorite snack — a simple, sweet treat with a hint of nostalgia.Dango – Naruto Chewy rice dumplings on skewers, glazed with sweet soy sauce. Often eaten during festivals, dango is a symbol of joy and camaraderie.Savoury DishesOnigiri (Single) – Demon Slayer Triangular rice balls wrapped in seaweed and filled with surprises like tangy pickled plum or seasoned vegetables — a staple in bento boxes and beloved by anime heroes on the go.Gyoza – Food Wars Pan-seared Japanese dumplings with a juicy, seasoned filling. These dumplings are ubiquitous in Food Wars' competitions, and here they’re served crisp with a dipping sauce.Nikuman – Haikyuu!! Fluffy steamed buns filled with savoury pork. This hearty snack is a popular reward after volleyball practice scenes in Haikyuu!!, and perfect for a quick burst of energy.MealsRamen – Naruto A steaming bowl of noodles in rich broth, topped with marinated egg, pork, and greens. This dish is practically a co-star in Naruto, where Ichiraku Ramen is a frequent backdrop.Katsudon – Yuri on Ice, My Hero Academia A comforting bowl of rice topped with crispy pork cutlet, soft scrambled egg, and sweet-salty sauce. Katsudon is often portrayed as a dish of encouragement and reward in anime.Chicken Karaage Bento Juicy, marinated fried chicken served with rice and pickles — this Japanese-style fried chicken bento is crunchy, satisfying, and a lunchbox favorite.Brinjal with Ponzu Bento A vegetarian bento featuring grilled or roasted brinjal dressed in a tangy ponzu sauce. Balanced, light, and packed with umami.Vegetarian variations are available upon request.

organizer.name: Jugni Kitchen + Bar
organizer.description: Welcome to Jugni, one of the best restaurants in Koramangala, where we bring you a dining experience that’s unapologetically Indian. At Jugni Kitchen & Bar, we’ve created a haven for those who seek more than just a meal; it's a place where nostalgia, comfort, and vibrant energy come together.

name: Starry Nights - Art | Music | Food
description: Join us on a beautiful rooftop as the Bangalore breeze sets the mood for a chill, art-filled night. For just ₹450, you’ll get access to a variety of DIY art activity options — whether you’re into painting, crafts, or just exploring something new, we’ve got you covered. No experience needed — just come as you are.What to expect:Multiple art stations with all materials providedA surprise food stall serving up delicious treats (available for purchase)Curated music that inspires and upliftsCozy, creative vibes and a stunning rooftop settingWhether you're planning a relaxed evening with friends or looking to try something different on your own, Starry Nights is the perfect alternative to the usual cafe or bar scene. Limited spots available — book now and make your weekend sparkle!Terms and ConditionsTicket Requirement: All attendees aged 4 and above must hold a valid ticket to enter the event.Booking Fee: The ticket price includes a booking fee of ₹450, which is fully redeemable against art and craft activities at the event.Photography & Videography: Photos and videos taken during the event may be used for social media and promotional purposes. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team upon arrival.Cancellations & Refunds: Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellations or no-shows.Weather Contingency: In case of rain, the event will either be moved to indoors or cancelled. If cancelled, a full refund will be processed.Food Policy: Outside food is not allowed at the venue.Parking: Parking is available in the vicinity of the venue at the vehicle owner's risk. Please note, valet service is not available.

location.address: 4th Floor, Suraj Ganga Arcade, 14th Cross Rd, 2nd Block, Jayanagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560011, India

organizer.name: The Firefly Terrace

description: Note: this time, Baithak will be held on a Sunday morning.About Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the ArtistUstaad Dilshad Khan is a tenth-generation Sarangi player from the renowned Sikar Gharana of Rajasthan. Trained under his grandfather, father, and later the legendary Ustad Sultan Khan Sahab, Dilshad has emerged as one of the foremost torchbearers of the Sarangi today.A celebrated soloist and collaborator, he has performed globally with maestros like Ustad Zakir Hussain and Pt. Birju Maharaj, and his music features in over 500 Bollywood films including Devdas and Dangal. name: Leela by Sanjay Divecha (Live) at Sabha BLR
description: Sanjay Divecha is one of the most revered guitar players in India. A unique and compelling voice as a player and composer, he is part of the hugely successful supergroup Cross Currents led by Zakir Hussain and featuring stalwarts such as Dave Holland, Vinnie Colaiuta, Chris Potter, Eddie Daniels, Shankar Mahadevan and Louiz Banks. Through a luminous 35 year long career, Sanjay has worked with artists such as Angelique Kidjo, Carlos Santana, Michael McDonald, Fred Raulston, Dave Weckl, Louis Johnson, Dumazz and Sambaguru among others.He also collaborated with A.R. Rahman on the Danny Boyle movie “127 Hours” that won ‘Best Original Score’, the OST for the movie “Woman on Top” with Argentinian composer Luis Bacalov, Sanjay also scored for the movie ‘Leela’ by Somnath Sen which won a Special Jury Award at Toronto Reel World Film Festival.An alumnus (1989) from Musician’s Institute (M.I) in Los Angeles, Sanjay continues to mentor and develop musicians all over the country. His students are not only guitar players, but composers, musicians and singers of all disciplines. Sanjay teaches private lessons and holds workshops to develop musicality and a well rounded aesthetic sensibility in musicians. Sanjay Divecha on the music of 'Leela' :As a human being on this planet I’ve always believed in the Oneness of all things in this universe. Going through life's bylanes and observing how events unfold and teach you the lessons to be learned, this belief of Oneness has only strengthened with time. My work as an artist has primarily been to connect with my inner self, and express from a place of honesty. The yearning to learn something new in my art and refine my skill set has been my constant companion. After having written and performed music with various ensembles, I finally mustered up the courage to record a collection of music which was mainly written for solo guitar, and also mainly recorded on acoustic guitar. These songs are reflections of some of my journeys and inspirations, interpreted in a spontaneous and instinctive manner. The title 'Leela' refers to the divine Leela - joyous and playful - yet a profound act of creation. As I started the recording process I started to add a few layers to enhance the music and some guest artists came on board to complete the experience which was truly fulfilling for me as an artist. The organic nature of this work takes me back to my formative years as a guitar player and I’m grateful to be sharing this work and for it to take its own journey.

name: Where You From: A Theatrical Poetry Performance
description: So tell me, where are you from, now that you're here? Are you from earth's kernels, or a childhood lane? Are you from a summer of love, or your innate politics? Are you from where they say you're from, or have you yet to find out?Where You From?This genre-defining show offers glimpses into the changing identities of a body in continued performance. Bringing cliff notes from a decade-long practice in creating works of words, Nupur Azadi - a slam poet emerged from Singapore - shows what is possible when meditations in movement, voicework, spoken word, and theatrical traditions come together.65-minute, devised-solo told in fours acts, without intermission.Multi-disciplinary and multi-media show suitable for audiences 16+.This show is part of A Decade of Theatrical Poetry celebration and was first shown during BLR Hubba, December 2024.

name: Build With AI
description: Mindful inputs. Meaningful outputs.Building with intention in an AI-powered world.We often treat AI like a shortcut—type, generate, copy, move on. But what if it could be something more?A collaborator. A mirror. A creative partner.In this session, we’ll explore how prompting can be an intentional act—one that blends clarity, curiosity, and craft.You’ll learn how to shape your prompts with care, how to align them with your voice and vision, and how understanding the architecture behind AI (transformers) can deepen — not dilute — your creative process. This is not just about “how to get better results.”It’s about building a more thoughtful relationship with the tools we use.Who is this for?​– Product managers and founders designing with AI in the loop– Writers, artists, and designers using AI to expand creative practice– Thinkers and makers seeking more depth, not just more speed– Anyone who wants to slow down and ask better questions​What you’ll take away​– Prompting frameworks that are simple, powerful, and intentional– A clearer understanding of how transformer models actually work– Real use-cases across product, content, and creative workflows– A fresh mindset toward working with AI, not just using it📍Location:  This is an online session — the Zoom link will be shared closer to the event date.

name: Woodcut Printing Beginner's Workshop
description: Woodcut Printing Beginner’s Workshop by Studio SakuraDiscover the Art of Relief PrintmakingStep into the tactile and timeless world of woodcut printmaking with our specially curated beginner’s workshop. Whether you’re an art enthusiast or someone looking to explore a new creative medium, this hands-on session is the perfect introduction to the rich tradition of relief printing.In this immersive workshop, participants will learn the fundamentals of woodcut—from understanding the tools and materials to designing, carving, and printing their very own artwork. Guided by experienced printmakers, you’ll explore the nuances of mark-making, learn how to safely use carving tools, and discover the magic of transferring ink from block to paper.What You’ll Learn:Introduction to relief printing and the history of woodcutHow to plan and transfer your design onto a woodblockCarving techniques and tool handlingInking and hand-printing your final compositionTips on setting up your own DIY printmaking setup at homeWhat’s Included:All materials and tools required for the sessionA carved woodblock that you can take home and reuse for future printingOne hand-pulled print.Step-by-step guidance and personalized feedback throughoutBy the end of the session, you’ll walk away not just with a beautiful print but with the confidence and skills to continue your printmaking journey independently.No prior experience needed—just your curiosity and creativity!About the Studio:Studio Sakura is a Bangalore-based printmaking studio that offers hands-on art workshops designed to make traditional techniques accessible and engaging. Founded by practicing printmakers, the studio focuses on creating a welcoming space for people to explore processes like linocut, woodcut, drypoint, and more. Whether you’re a curious beginner or an experienced artist, Studio Sakura’s workshops are crafted to inspire creativity, build skills, and foster community through print. Each session is thoughtfully designed to ensure participants leave not only with beautiful handmade prints, but also the confidence to continue creating independently.
